titleInfo.title: Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections
titleInfo.subTitle: e Gerald L. Rushfelt on 4/7/2010. (byk)MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 9 Defendant's Motion for Stay of Discovery; and 9 Motion for Additional Time to Answer. All Rule 26 proceedings, discovery, and pretrial proceedings are hereby stayed until the Court rules on Defendants Motion to Dismiss. It is further ordered that if the motion to dismiss is denied in whole or in part, Defendant has twenty (20) days from the date of that decision within which to answer the Complaint or otherwise respond thereto. Signed by Magistrate Judg

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:10-cv-02086; Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Kansas
extension.docketText: e Gerald L. Rushfelt on 4/7/2010. (byk)MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 9 Defendant's Motion for Stay of Discovery; and 9 Motion for Additional Time to Answer. All Rule 26 proceedings, discovery, and pretrial proceedings are hereby stayed until the Court rules on Defendants Motion to Dismiss. It is further ordered that if the motion to dismiss is denied in whole or in part, Defendant has twenty (20) days from the date of that decision within which to answer the Complaint or otherwise respond thereto. Signed by Magistrate Judg

titleInfo.title: Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting defendant's 9 Motion to Dismiss and denying plaintiff's 11 Motion to Amend Complaint without prejudice to refile a motion that is in compliance with D. Kan. Rule 15.1 within fourteen (14) days of the date of this Order. Signed by District Judge Julie A. Robinson on 8/18/10. (pp)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:10-cv-02086; Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections;

extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting defendant's 9 Motion to Dismiss and denying plaintiff's 11 Motion to Amend Complaint without prejudice to refile a motion that is in compliance with D. titleInfo.title: Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting in part and denying in part 19 Motion to Amend Complaint. Plaintiffs motion is denied to the extent he continues to name the KDOC as a defendant, and is granted as to the remainder of his proposed Amended Complaint. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that plaintiff is directed to omit the KDOC as a named defendant in this lawsuit, and file an Amended Complaint that complies with the Courts directive within fourteen (14) days of this Order, as required by D. Kan. Rule 15.1(b). Signed by District Judge Julie A. Robinson on 11/23/20. Mailed to pro se party Curtis Nichols, 403 Olive Street, Leavenworth, KS 66048 by certified mail; Certified Tracking Number: 70092250000317235710. (pp) Modified text on 11/24/2010 (mb).

titleInfo.title: Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER denying 57 Motion to Facilitate Service. Plaintiff is granted thirty (30) days, or up to and including February 3, 2012, within which to provide the Marshals Service with thecurrent location and address for Defendants James Arnold and Michael Schmidling for the purpose of serving Plaintiffs amended complaint. The Court further orders that the failure to do so will result in dismissal of the complaint without further prior notice to the Plaintiff. The amended complaint is dismissed, without prejudice, with respect to Defendant Ben Reynolds; Signed by District Judge Julie A. Robinson on 1/3/2012.Mailed to pro se party Curtis Nichols, 460 Reveilly Trail, Apt 101, Lansing, KS 66403 by certified mail ; Certified Tracking Number: 710101060000094297558 (pp)

titleInfo.title: Nichols v. Kansas Department of Corrections
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER denying 64 Motion to Amend. For the reasons set out in the Memorandum and Order, the Court denies Plaintiff leave to file another amended complaint. Certified Tracking Number: 7002 2030 0000 9348 8909. (bw)
